title: The Pumpkin Brawl
description: Two men from the Block D community garden got into a fight over their prize pumpkins. One pumpkin was destroyed, a market stall was damaged, and both men are blaming each other. Determine who started the altercation.
stateChoice: Convict the aggressor who started the fight and destroyed the pumpkin.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: The enforcer report says you and Goran were fighting in the market square. What happened?

responseSequence: Goran started it. He's been talking trash about my pumpkin for weeks.
He said mine was rotten inside. In front of everyone. I pushed him. That's it.
Okay, maybe I threw the first punch.
But he had it coming. You should have heard what he said about my pumpkin.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Goran's pumpkin was smashed during the fight. Did you destroy it?

responseSequence: It fell off the table during the scuffle. I didn't smash it on purpose.
Things got knocked around. It was chaos.
Fine. I grabbed it and threw it on the ground.
His pumpkin was bigger than mine. I was angry. It was stupid.

clickableClues.clickableText: His pumpkin was bigger than mine
clickableClues.noteText: <person>Borislav</person> admits he destroyed <person>Goran</person>'s pumpkin out of jealousy because it was larger than his own

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: A market stall was damaged in the fight. Who knocked it over?

responseSequence: That was Goran. He shoved me into it.
I was just defending myself.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: A witness says you threw the first punch. Is that true?

responseSequence: Who said that? Was it Mara? She's always taking Goran's side.
I pushed him first, maybe. But he provoked me.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Goran has bruises on his face and a cut lip. You gave him those?

responseSequence: He hit me too! Look at my knuckles.
It was a fight. We both got hurt.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: You admit you were jealous of his pumpkin. That's why you started the fight?

responseSequence: Jealous is a strong word.
I spent three months on that pumpkin. He spent three months making sure everyone knew his was bigger. It got to me.

lawyeredUpResponses: It was a fight over a pumpkin. Are we really doing this?
I'm not saying anything else about a vegetable.
Just charge me and let me go home.
rattledResponses: It was stupid. The whole thing was stupid.
My wife is going to kill me.
Over a pumpkin. I'm here over a pumpkin.
shutdownResponses: It's a pumpkin. That's all I have to say.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: The enforcer report says you were involved in a public fight. What happened?

responseSequence: Borislav punched me. Out of nowhere.
We were showing our pumpkins from the community garden. People were looking, having a nice time. Then he just snapped.

clickableClues.noteText: <person>Goran</person> says <person>Borislav</person> attacked him unprovoked while they were showing pumpkins at the community garden display

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Your pumpkin was destroyed during the fight. Did Borislav do that?

responseSequence: He grabbed it off the table and slammed it on the ground.
Three months of work. Gone. Because he couldn't stand that mine was bigger.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: A market stall was knocked over. Did you cause that?

responseSequence: I was trying to get away from him. I backed into it.
I didn't mean to damage anything. He was swinging at me.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Did you provoke Borislav in any way?

responseSequence: I was just standing there with my pumpkin. People were complimenting it.
Maybe he felt embarrassed. But I never said a word to him about his.
Bruises on my face, cut lip, sore ribs.
I fought back. I'm not going to stand there and get beaten. But I didn't start it.

lawyeredUpResponses: I defended myself. That's not a crime.
Ask the witness. She saw everything.
I've told you the truth. What more do you need?
rattledResponses: He destroyed my pumpkin. Three months of work.
I just want this to be over.
We're neighbors. We have to see each other every day.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: You were at the market when the fight happened. What did you see?

responseSequence: Both boys had their pumpkins on display. People were admiring them.
Goran's was bigger. You could see Borislav getting redder and redder. Then he just went at him.

clickableClues.noteText: Witness <person>Mara Tomic</person> confirms <person>Borislav</person> attacked <person>Goran</person> first after becoming visibly angry that Goran's pumpkin was larger

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Did you see what happened to the pumpkin?

responseSequence: Borislav grabbed Goran's pumpkin and threw it on the cobblestones.
Smashed it to pieces. The seeds went everywhere. Goran looked like he was going to cry.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: A market stall was damaged. How did that happen?

responseSequence: Goran was backing away from Borislav and bumped into old Radko's vegetable stall.
Knocked the whole thing over. Radko was furious. But it wasn't Goran's fault — he was trying to get away.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Who got hurt worse in the fight?

responseSequence: Goran. Borislav is bigger. He's a bricklayer — arms like logs.
Goran got a few hits in, but Borislav did most of the damage.

clickableClues.clickableText: Borislav did most of the damage
clickableClues.noteText: Witness <person>Mara</person> confirms <person>Borislav</person> caused more physical harm to <person>Goran</person> during the fight

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Are you certain Borislav started the fight?

responseSequence: I was standing three meters away. I saw the whole thing.
Borislav threw the first punch. Then he grabbed the pumpkin. Then the enforcers came.

lawyeredUpResponses: I'm just a witness. I told you what I saw.
Do you need me to write it down? I can write it down.
I'm not involved. I was just watching.
rattledResponses: They're both good boys really. This was just silly.
Garden disputes happen every year. Usually not this bad.
Am I in trouble? I just came to watch the pumpkins.
shutdownResponses: I'm an old woman. I need to go home.

evidences.title: Bureau Case File #1042
evidences.description: Official case assignment from the Bureau of Pattern Compliance. Contains the case summary, suspect information, and evidence inventory.

evidences.title: Enforcer Patrol Report
evidences.description: The responding enforcer's report documenting the disturbance at the Block D community market. Includes descriptions of the scene, injuries observed, and property damage.

hotspots.noteText: Enforcers responded to a disturbance at the <location>Block D community market</location> involving <person>Borislav Kovac</person> and <person>Goran Petrovic</person> fighting near the garden display
<person>Goran Petrovic</person> sustained bruises to the face, a cut lip, and reported sore ribs. <person>Borislav Kovac</person> had bruised knuckles.

evidences.title: Property Damage Assessment
evidences.description: An assessment of damage to the market area including a smashed pumpkin and a knocked-over vegetable stall belonging to vendor Radko.

hotspots.noteText: One large pumpkin belonging to <person>Goran Petrovic</person> was found smashed on the cobblestones near the display table
Vendor <person>Radko</person>'s vegetable stall was knocked over during the altercation. Estimated damage: 15 knots in lost produce

steps.description: Read the enforcer report and damage assessment to understand what happened
Interrogate the witness to establish who started the fight
Confront both suspects with the evidence and witness testimony
